Cupping is an old method of 'letting the bad blood out" which just means there's a cut done on your back and a suction cup (usually glass) that's heated up is applied on top of the incision. The suction sucks out the so called bad blood. Sounds gruesome but everyone I know that has had it swears by it.

Hiccup cure - hold your breath, but you have to do it for 30 seconds (or until you have a strong urge to breathe again, basically). Hiccups are basically a leftover reflex from in the womb, exercising the diaphragm without aspirating amniotic fluid. When you hold your breath, I'm told, the CO2 build-up in your blood tells the vegus nerve to stop the hiccups so you can breathe.
